children.name: town
children.definition: a large area with houses, shops, offices etc where people live and work, that is smaller than a city and larger than a village: thị trấn , thị xã
examples: an industrial town in the Midlands
the town of Warrington/Poitiers/Kimball etc[written]
A large sign announced that we were entering the town of Knock.
the town of Norwalk, Connecticut
a little towna pretty little town in the French Alps
a seaside townyoung people looking for seasonal work in seaside towns
part of town
Steyne Street was a narrow street in a shabby but respectable part of town.
town[attri adj]
The town council has proposed a new road building project.
With better town planning, traffic problems could be avoided.
town squarea square in the centre of a town
A market is held daily in the town square.

children.name: small/big
examples: I grew up in a small town in Iowa.|The nearest big town is 20 miles away.

children.name: a major town
examples: It is one of the UK’s biggest retailers with shops in every major town.

children.name: busy/bustling
examples: The town was busy even in November.

children.name: quiet
examples: The town is quiet in the summer.|Cannigione is a quiet little town with a scattering of shops, restaurants and cafes.

children.name: sleepy
children.definition: very quiet, with not much happening
examples: Johnson grew up in the sleepy retirement town of Asheville.

children.name: a historic/ancient town
examples: Visitors can go on a tour of this historic town.

children.name: an industrial town
examples: Thousands moved to the newly forming industrial towns to work in the mills.

children.name: a provincial town
children.definition: one that is not near the capital
examples: Many provincial towns were transformed by the coming of the railway.

children.name: a market town
children.definition: a town in Britain where there is a regular outdoor market
examples: The pretty market town of Ashbourne is only 9 miles away.

children.name: sb’s home town
children.definition: the town where someone was born
examples: He was buried in his home town of Leeds.

children.name: a new town
children.definition: one of several towns built in Britain since 1946
examples: The design of Milton Keynes and other new towns proved unpopular.

children.name: the centre of town/the town centre
examples: British English,the center of town/the town centerAmerican English The hotel was right in the center of town.

children.name: the outskirts/edge of a town
examples: It was six o'clock when she reached the outskirts of the town.

children.name: city
children.definition: abigandimportanttown that is often the centre of government for an area, has a lot of trade and industry, and is likely to contain important political, educational, or religious institutions: thành phố
examples: The nearest big city was St. Louis.
the city of Belfast/Jerusalem/Boston etc[written]
The city of Barcelona is famous for its wonderful architecture.
the ancient city of Damascus
an ancient citythe ancient city of Jerusalem
a garden city[UK] a town that has been planned to include a lot of trees, plants and open spaces : thành phố xanh
city lifethe advantages of city life
city[attri adj] relating to or in a city:
The city library cost over $15 million to build.
Residents blame city officials for poor housing conditions.
the city authorities
city streets
Beneath the city streets is a network of sewers.
city life
City life is becoming increasingly dangerous.

children.name: a big/large/major city
examples: They have stores in Houston, Dallas, and other big cities.

children.name: a great city
children.definition: very important and interesting
examples: Cairo is one of the world's great cities.

children.name: a capital city
children.definition: where the government of a country or state is
examples: Cuba's capital city is Havana.

children.name: sb’s home/native city
children.definition: where they were born or grew up
examples: He said that he never wanted to leave his home city.

children.name: a cosmopolitan city
children.definition: full of people from different parts of the world
examples: San Francisco is a very cosmopolitan city.

children.name: an industrial city
examples: Sheffield is an industrial city in the north of England.

children.name: a provincial city
children.definition: in a part of the country that is not near the capital
examples: There have been protests in the capital and in provincial cities.

children.name: a historic city
children.definition: very old and with an interesting history
examples: Budapest is a beautiful and historic city.

children.name: a cathedral city
children.definition: with a cathedral
examples: He went to university in the cathedral city of Durham.

children.name: a university city
children.definition: with a university
examples: Uppsala is a university city.

children.name: a walled city
children.definition: surrounded by a wall
examples: the old walled city of Alghero

children.name: a twin cityUK
children.definition: one that has a special relationship with a similar town in another country
examples: Strasbourg is Leicester's twin city in France.

children.name: the city centre
examples: British English,the city centerAmerican English The hotel is in the city centre.

children.name: the city limitsAmerican English
children.definition: the furthest parts of the city
examples: rural areas south of the city limits

children.name: a city dweller
children.definition: someone who lives in a city
examples: In the summer, city dwellers escape to the sea.

children.name: a city street
examples: Traffic was moving slowly along the city streets.

children.name: in the heart of a city
examples: The cathedral is right in the heart of the city.

children.name: the outskirts of a city
children.definition: the edge
examples: There were several bombings on the outskirts of the city.

children.name: found a city
children.definition: start developing a new city
examples: He founded the city of Baghdad in the 8th century.

children.name: village
children.definition: a very small town in the country: làng
examples: There are some nice little pubs in the villages round here.
She left her village in the north of Thailand and went to live in Bangkok.

children.name: small/little/tiny
examples: They come from a small village in Laos.

children.name: pretty/picturesque
examples: There are many pretty villages nearby.

children.name: remote
children.definition: one that is far away from larger towns
examples: We need to get food aid to the more remote villages.

children.name: quiet/sleepy
children.definition: one where there is not a lot of activity
examples: Downham was a sleepy little village, with a road barely wide enough for one car.

children.name: a fishing village
examples: Once a fishing village, this is now a friendly, lively international resort.

children.name: a mountain/hilltop village
examples: The paths lead to picturesque mountain villages.

children.name: village[attri adj][
examples: UK]relating to a village:

children.name: the village green
children.definition: area of grass for everyone to use
examples: a cricket match on the village green

children.name: village life
children.definition: all the activities in a village
examples: She had always taken an active part in village life.

children.name: a little fishing village
examples: There is a village festival every year at the beginning of May.
Has village life changed significantly in the last few years?

children.name: village shop/school/hall etc
examples: We have a church, one pub and a village shop.
A meeting will be held at the village hall on Tuesday.

children.name: settlement
children.definition: a place where people come to live for the first time and where they build a village or town, especially where few people have lived before: nơi an cư, nơi định cư
examples: She lived in a small settlement on the edge of the desert.
Settlements started to appear all along the river.
The tools were found in an early Iron Age settlement.
settlement[U] [C2] when a lot of people move to a place in order to live there, especially in a place where not many people have lived before : định cư, an cư
settlement of
the settlement of the American West
Many Native Americans were killed during the settlementofthe American West by Europeans in the nineteenth century.

children.name: port
children.definition: a town or city with a harbour or docks where ships can be loaded or unloaded: thành phố cảng
examples: Britain’s largest port
a naval/fishing/container port
We had a good view of all the shipscoming into/leavingport

children.name: the town where you are from
home town
children.definition: / hometown  the town where you were born, where you lived as a child, or where you live now: thành phố quê hương
examples: Sarajevo is my home town and I did not want to leave.
He was born in Bristol, but he considers London his home town since he's lived there most of his life.

children.name: home town of
examples: Johnson lived in Seattle for ten years before returning to his home town of Cody, Wyoming.

children.name: home
children.definition: the place where you were born or the place where you usually live, especially if this is where you feel happy and want to live: quê nhà
examples: Her home, she said, was in Hong Kong, but she hadn’t been there since she was a child.

children.name: feel like home
examples: I’ve lived in Madrid for many years, and it feels like home to me now.

children.name: relating to towns, cities in general
urban
children.definition: relating to towns and cities, the people who live in them, or the things that happen in them: thành thị
examples: The problem of air pollution is especially serious inurban areas.
China’s growing urban population
urban development/growth
post-war urban planning

children.name: civic
children.definition: relating to the government of a city or town: đô thị, thành phố, thị xã
examples: An important civic function is taking place in the city hall this evening.
Harlow Council has always been generous with civic funding for music and the arts.
The Prime Minister met many civicleaders, including the mayor and the leaders of the immigrant communities.
She felt it was her civicduty(= her duty as a person living in the town) to tell the police.
The opera house is a great source of civicpride.

children.name: municipal
children.definition: relating to the government of a town or city or to the public services it provides: thành phố, thị xã, đô thị
examples: Municipal elections will be held on April 12th.
Not far from the town centre is the municipal park.
The museum and other municipal buildings are threatened.

children.name: capital
children.definition: the town or city where the government of a country or area is: thủ đô, thủ phủ
examples: Rome is one of the world’s most beautiful capitals.

children.name: capital of
examples: What’s the capital of Canada?

children.name: capital city
examples: The tour includes a trip to Budapest, Hungary’s capital city.

children.name: state/regional/provincial etc capital
examples: Sacramento is the state capital of California.

children.name: metropolis
children.definition: the largest, most important city in a country or area - use this especially to emphasize that a city is busy and full of people and activity: thủ đô
examples: After 1850 Paris grew quickly into a busy metropolis.
They drove quickly, leaving the immense metropolis behind them.
metropolis of
Our aim is to make Sydney the musical metropolis of the world.
metropolitan[attri adj] relating to a large city:
Some workers can only afford homes outside metropolitan areas.
the metropolitan authorities
the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York
He was drawn to the metropolitan glamour and excitement of Paris.
a metropolitan area/council
